p: Additional arthritogenic alphaviruses of clinical significance include Sindbis virus, Ross River virus, Mayaro virus, and O’nyong’nyong virus (ONNV) [ 1]. So far, these alphaviruses have not caused large outbreaks on the scale of CHIKV epidemics. An exception is ONNV, which is transmitted by Anopheles gambiae mosquitos and infected more than 2 million people in East Africa from 1959 to 1961 before smoldering out [ 1, 4].
